intro: Crepidomanes pervenulosum, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to sandy and rocky soils in temperate regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
